'Maleic acid' is an organic compound that is a dicarboxylic acid, a molecule
with two carboxyl groups. Its chemical formula is
HO 2CCHCHCO 2H. Maleic acid is the ''cis''-isomer of
butenedioic acid, whereas fumaric acid is the trans-isomer. It is mainly used as
a precursor to fumaric acid, and relative to its parent maleic anhydride, maleic
acid has few applications.
